title: R43956
content: The Radiation Exposure Compensation Act (RECA), enacted in 1990, provides one-time cash benefits to individuals who participated in atomic weapons testing or lived near the Nevada Test Site during atmospheric atomic weapons testing. Benefits are also available to uranium industry workers between 1942 and 1971 who contracted specified medical conditions after possible radiation exposure. The Radiation Exposure Compensation Act (RECA) provides cash benefits to individuals involved in atomic weapons testing or uranium industry work between 1942 and 1971. Claimants must have specific medical conditions after radiation exposure. The program is managed by the Department of Justice, with over 30,000 approved claims totaling nearly $2 billion.
